snippet.textDisplay: I felt like I was an actual hero after beating this game cause of this song. This song is so amazing that it made me literally cry after beating the game. Noriyuki Iwadare is such an amazing composer, and he has pretty much changed my taste of music. I’m so happy I got to play this game. It’s my favorite game of all time.
snippet.textOriginal: I felt like I was an actual hero after beating this game cause of this song. This song is so amazing that it made me literally cry after beating the game. Noriyuki Iwadare is such an amazing composer, and he has pretty much changed my taste of music. I’m so happy I got to play this game. It’s my favorite game of all time.

snippet.textDisplay: The ps1 zophar is scary in a more obvious and confrontational way, but CD zophar is much more ominous and unnerving. Zophar's gaze and posture are simultaneously malevonent and motherly; the device holding lucia captive, as well as the bead-like tendrils that flow through his hair look like internal organs, and his distorted ear all come together to make you feel as though something is terribly wrong.
snippet.textOriginal: The ps1 zophar is scary in a more obvious and confrontational way, but CD zophar is much more ominous and unnerving. Zophar's gaze and posture are simultaneously malevonent and motherly; the device holding lucia captive, as well as the bead-like tendrils that flow through his hair look like internal organs, and his distorted ear all come together to make you feel as though something is terribly wrong.

snippet.textDisplay: Yeah, not so scary compare to this one.
snippet.textOriginal: Yeah, not so scary compare to this one.

snippet.textDisplay:
I played the PS1 remake,
But I must say, now that I heard this Sega CD version of the theme, it sounds way better than the newer one!
snippet.textOriginal:
I played the PS1 remake,
But I must say, now that I heard this Sega CD version of the theme, it sounds way better than the newer one!

snippet.textDisplay: The SEGA CD version is compressed and in mono, but most of the songs feel more complete in that version.  The one song I'd say sounds bad is the original Zophar battle theme (not the true final boss theme), because the compression is really bad.
snippet.textOriginal: The SEGA CD version is compressed and in mono, but most of the songs feel more complete in that version.  The one song I'd say sounds bad is the original Zophar battle theme (not the true final boss theme), because the compression is really bad.

snippet.textDisplay: The worst part is that they gave Zophar the standard boss theme for the first stage of the fight.
snippet.textOriginal: The worst part is that they gave Zophar the standard boss theme for the first stage of the fight.

snippet.textDisplay: ikr it feels like they tried to add to many instruments, and the drum base in the cd version is 100% superior
snippet.textOriginal: ikr it feels like they tried to add to many instruments, and the drum base in the cd version is 100% superior

snippet.textDisplay:
Ahhhh...Still one of my all time favorite final boss themes. So...Awesome. Really catches the scale that the cast are just little humans who stick it to a being of near godly power.

Completely badass
snippet.textOriginal:
Ahhhh...Still one of my all time favorite final boss themes. So...Awesome. Really catches the scale that the cast are just little humans who stick it to a being of near godly power.

Completely badass

snippet.textDisplay: The intro reminds me of Dahlia Hawthorne's theme from Phoenix Wright Ace Attorney: Trials and Tribulations, though this theme in general sounds kinda like the Final Fantasy IV final boss theme...
snippet.textOriginal: The intro reminds me of Dahlia Hawthorne's theme from Phoenix Wright Ace Attorney: Trials and Tribulations, though this theme in general sounds kinda like the Final Fantasy IV final boss theme...

snippet.textDisplay: @SchwarzerFrost1989 Either starts from beginning (like in, say, Medievil) ... or maybe it loops in the game, but not in the soundtrack version. Most soundtrack versions of various background themes loop forever and ever, having just a fadeout as their ending.
snippet.textOriginal: @SchwarzerFrost1989 Either starts from beginning (like in, say, Medievil) ... or maybe it loops in the game, but not in the soundtrack version. Most soundtrack versions of various background themes loop forever and ever, having just a fadeout as their ending.

snippet.textDisplay: Fighting the last boss with this theme playing was very epic, especially back in the mid 90s. I've already said it on some other video, but I like how Iwadare is one of the few composers who actually add an end to his themes, it doesn't loop.
snippet.textOriginal: Fighting the last boss with this theme playing was very epic, especially back in the mid 90s. I've already said it on some other video, but I like how Iwadare is one of the few composers who actually add an end to his themes, it doesn't loop.
